p: At the time of writing, trends in incidence data suggest multiple countries, including China, South Korea, Spain, and Italy, have successfully implemented suppression strategies ( 12). Sweden is the poster child for mitigation strategies, and appears to be aiming for herd immunity ( 13). Meanwhile, other countries continue to experience sustained transmission, and strategic intention is less clear [including the United States ( 14) and United Kingdom ( 15)]. The severe economic costs and acute societal pressures associated with social distancing measures have led to a push for their relaxation ( 10). Given the potentially long wait until a vaccine is available, the UK government appears to have considered following Swedenâ€™s example and attempt to achieve herd immunity in the country ( 16).
